intro: Viola canina var. lactea, commonly known as the milk viola, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, heart-shaped leaves and showy violet flowers. The plant typically grows in woodland areas and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers, which bloom in early spring, are often pale purple or white, and the species is noted for its ornamental value. Viola canina var. lactea is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
